subject: Personal Finance
title: Leverage: Debt as a Tool
description: One-minute skill: Leverage: Debt as a Tool.

hook.text: You have $50,000. You could buy one house. Or borrow and buy five. That's leverage.

buildup.text: Leverage means using borrowed money to amplify potential returns on an investment.

discovery.text: If your properties rise 10%, you made $25,000 on $50,000 invested â€” a 50% return.

twist.text: If they fall 10%, you lost $25,000. Leverage amplifies losses just as much as gains.

climax.text: The 2008 crisis happened because banks leveraged 30-to-1. A small loss wiped out everything.

punchline.text: Leverage is a magnifying glass for risk.

quiz.question: What is financial leverage?
options: Using borrowed money to amplify returns
